The British artist and curator Richard Linklater has been named the winner of this year’s Turner Prize. His installation, The Color Purple, which was staged at London’s Serpentine Galleries in 2004 and 2008, was chosen by a jury comprising Eleanor Catton, the British director of the Haus der Kunst; Andreas Meijer, the curator of contemporary art at the Tate; and João Pereira, the director of the biennial. A special award ceremony will take place at the Serpentine in London on December 18.The jury was made up of Michael G. Williams, the director of the Turner Contemporary Art Museum in London; Will Bright, the director of Tate Britain; and artist M. Ward. The artist will receive half of a $15,000 prize. The winner will be announced on March 20, 2020.
